instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 S0 rails pulsing
threads.message:
Got this board, no liquid damage. 


Green/orange light, fan try to spin and s0 rails pulsing. ALL SYS  also pulses. Already checked all traces on U6100 and resistors on SPI Bus Series Termination and all are ok. No visible damage. 


My guess is U6100 but i dont have medusa for now. Anyway to check if there is something else or it is defenitly EFI?

threads.title: 820-00165 S0 rails pulsing
threads.message:
To suspect SPI, you should get pulse at PLT_RESET_L first.
Do you get pulse at pins 7 & 3 of U1950?
VCORE pulsing too?

threads.title: 820-00165 S0 rails pulsing
threads.message:
Yes, PIn 7 and 3 are pulsing up to 3.3. and Vcore is also pulsing to 1.05V.


P.S. when i measure pin 7 on U1950 sometimes fan spins and but there is no image. :S


Same happened when measered PLT RESET, but when not starting PLR doesnt pulse

threads.title: 820-00165 S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: Test removing U8130...

threads.title: 820-00165 S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: without U8130 fan spins, doesnt stop, but nothing getting warm.

threads.title: 820-00165 S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: Try good BIOS now...

threads.title: 820-00165 S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: well, as i have not medusa, will buy chip and once it arrived will back with result, Thanks

threads.title: 820-00165 S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: I have just found that U8005 had corrosion. Changed it and now fan stopped spinning.

threads.title: 820-00165 S0 rails pulsing
threads.message:
"will buy chip "
What chip???
Don't you have normal programmer to flash U6100, once removed from MLB?

Solder back U8130 (after changed U8005) and try again.

threads.title: 820-00165 S0 rails pulsing
threads.message:
i dont have programmer, because i dont have many efi issues macs. Usually i buy clear efi and never had problem with that.


P.S: Soldered back U8130 and nothing happens now.


Main S0 rails pulsing, without U8005 fan spins (just spins)

threads.title: 820-00165 S0 rails pulsing
threads.message:
[USER=682]@2informaticos[/USER] you still think its bios with this symptoms?
PLT_RESET  not pulsing

threads.title: 820-00165 S0 rails pulsing
threads.message:
Shouldn't be BIOS; PLT_RESET_L is required before PCH accesses U6100.
Board stays on w/ U8005 and w/o U8130?

threads.title: 820-00165 S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: When U8005 is removed fan spins but no image no chime.

threads.title: 820-00165 S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: PP1V05_S0SW_PCH_HSIO is shorting to ground when i put U8005

threads.title: 820-00165 S0 rails pulsing
threads.message:
What is the exact ohm value?
Did you check it w/o U8005 too?

threads.title: 820-00165 S0 rails pulsing
threads.message:
PP1V05_S0SW_PCH_HSIO short disappeared, seems that U8005 was soldered bad. Now With and without resistance to ground - 450 Ohms

and like before: with u8005 no fan spin without fan spins.

threads.title: 820-00165 S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: Do you get at least voltage pulse at  PP1V05_S0SW_PCH_HSIO ?

threads.title: 820-00165 S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: yes, it is pulsing up to 1.05 and goes down every few seconds.

threads.title: 820-00165 S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: Did you try SMC bypass?

threads.title: 820-00165 S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: Yes, smc by pass first make fan spins for 1 second than stops, and than fan making "clicks" trying to sping but not spinning.

threads.title: 820-00165 S0 rails pulsing
threads.message:
When U8130 renoved, PLT_RESET_L stays high?
If yes, try BIOS  then...

threads.title: 820-00165 S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: Will check it later today and post result. Thanks
